meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Sandy Hall Chris Becker Mara Apostol Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7225.

td.p: Sandy Hall, a nurse residency program manager originally from Evansville, Indiana
Chris Becker, a bus driver and trainer from Orlando, Florida
Mara Apostol, a criminal defense attorney from Miami, Florida (whose 1-day cash winnings total $16,801)

tr.td: (Po: I'm Po, the Dragon Warrior, presenting five other unconventional warriors.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Has its name on a ferry that transports approximately 70,000 passengers each weekday')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Has its name on a ferry that transports approximately 70,000 passengers each weekday

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', 'Dwight Schrute, on this sitcom: "I did not become a... volunteer sheriff\'s deputy to make friends. & by the way, I haven\'t"')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Po delivers the clue.) This British admiral, killed during his greatest victory at Trafalgar, was blind in one eye but didn\'t wear an eyepatch. You know I would have. Nobody messes with you when you wear an eyepatch')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Po delivers the clue.) This British admiral, killed during his greatest victory at Trafalgar, was blind in one eye but didn't wear an eyepatch. You know I would have. Nobody messes with you when you wear an eyepatch

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_5', 'clue_J_6_5_stuck', '(Po delivers the clue.) Jordan Noble was just 14 when he played the long roll in this 1815 battle, Andrew Jackson\'s victory over the British; so was a drummer, but\'s that\'s OK. We can\'t alI be, you know, in the thick of the fight')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Po delivers the clue.) Jordan Noble was just 14 when he played the long roll in this 1815 battle, Andrew Jackson's victory over the British; so was a drummer, but's that's OK. We can't alI be, you know, in the thick of the fight

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: (Alex: And next, we have an interesting twist to [*]. You'll see when we get into the category.)

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Chris] "Fortune" very important to [*]. "If I\'m be--going to be a traitor to my country, I wanna get paid.")
SandyWho was Hamilton?
$9,799
MaraWho is ?
$9,201
ChrisWho was Cornwallis?
$3,001
Benedict Arnold')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'He wrote, "As life and fortune are risked by serving his majesty, it is necessary that the latter shall be secured"')

tr.td: He wrote, "As life and fortune are risked by serving his majesty, it is necessary that the latter shall be secured"

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
